FROM: ARYACORP PVT. LTD.
DATE & TIME: 16-08-2024 12:57:58   (GMT +5:30)
REFERΕNCE NO: 17701370
ATTN CHARTERING DESK
DEAR SIR
GOOD DAY
DIRECT OWNERS VESSEL
PLEASE ADVISE SUITABLE CARGO FOR BELOW VESSEL
MV TENROU MARU - SMX - OPEN CHITTAGONG - 21-22TH  AUG
PREFER ECI - CHINA
Vessel’s Description
MV Tenrou Maru
57,593MTDWT on Summer sea draft of 12.818M
Built: Feb, 2016 Shipyard: TSUNEISHI Heavy Industries (CEBU), Inc.
Flag: Ile of man Flag Class: NK
Gross/Net tonnage: 32,540/19,282 LOA/Beam/Depth: 189.99M / 32.296M / 18.018M
5Hatches No.1： 18.00L (m) x 17.00B (m) No.2 to No.4： 20.93L (m) x 18.6B (m) No.5： 20.70L (m) x 18.6B (m)
Type of hatch covers: Folding type Cranes: 4 x 30MTcap (30mt x 18.5/min and max slewing radius:26)
M/E: Mitsui Man B & W 7S50ME-B9.3 MCO 8,470kW x 90.0rpm CSO 6,510kW x 90.7rpm
Bunker Tank Cap: 1,975.00m3 (100%) for F.O.T. / 164.6m3(100%) for D.O.T Basis MT for 85% of tank capacity due to safety allowance as follows;
No.1 F.O.T. (P/S): abt.558m3 No.2 F.O.T. (P/S): abt.587.69m3 No.3 F.O.T. (P/S): abt.533m3 No.
1 D.O.T. (S): abt.72.5m3 No.2 D.O.T. (S): abt.67.44m3 Fresh water tanks: 300.00m3 (100%) / 255.00MT(85%) Cement holes are fitted on each hatch cover. (Total 10 holes/ship) A-60 insulation is fitted. Hold Co2 not fitted.
4 Grabs Fitted.
No Deck Cargo 1 Tank top Uniform Load： No.1
Cargo Hold：25.3 t/m2 No.2 Cargo Hold：18.3 t/m2 No.3 Cargo Hold：25.3 t/m2 No.4 Cargo Hold：18.3 t/m2 No.5
Cargo Hold：25.3 t/m2 Hot Coil： 15mt x 2.0 tiers x 1.5m width with 4dunnages 20mt x 1.5 tiers x 1.5m width with 4dunnages 25mt x 1.0 tier x 1.5m width with 4dunnages
-All figures ‘about’
～Speed / Consumption
At Sea
Ballast: about 14.00 knots under good weather conditions up to and including BF4 and Douglas sea state 3
Laden: about 13.50 knots under good weather conditions up to and including BF4 and Douglas sea state 3
Laden/Ballast: about. 26.1m/t (VLSFO)
No LSMGO at sea but vessel may use LS when entering/leaving port, maneuvering and in narrow, shallow or congested waters, rivers, straits, canal, when ballasting /de-ballasting, heating fuel in cold weather, familiarization, maintenance and others in case of need.
Bunker Consumption at most reduced speed ：(WOG)
(MCR 45%, RPM 87 )
Ballast: about 12.00 knots
Laden: about 11.50 knots
Laden/ballast: about 16.2m/t (VLSFO)
Vessel’s slow steaming subject to the vessel to run at full speed for minimum 1 hour every day. Daily running at CSO for 1 hour has been taken into account for fuel oil consumption calculation. Above condition are considered for vessel in good weather condition and without guarantee bases.
In Port
Loading: about 5.0 m/t(VLSFO) + about 0.5 m/t (LSMGO)
Idle : about 2.0 m/t(VLSFO) + about 0.5 m/t (LSMGO)
all details about, wog.
PLSD TO HEAR.
BEST REGARDS,
